moves.2... d5 3. exd5 cxd5 4. Bb3 Nc6 5. c3: White would be more active with d4 and a chance to play c4 later.
moves.5... e5 6. h3: I understand that a pin is not desirable, but this is not necessary. A knight on d2 and queen on c2 solves the problem.
moves.6... Nf6 7. a3: Unnecessary again. Nf3 is much more natural.
moves.7... Be7 8. d3: A passive move. Black has more space and white should be concerned about its impending constriction.
moves.8... Be6 9. Nf3 Qd7: Setting up bishop takes h3 threats.
moves.10. Be3 d4: Double attack. I wanted to continue to build on my space advantage, but I exposed my bishop to an exchange. My light-squared bishop is better not exchanged.
moves.13... Bxh3: I wasn't exactly sure of the circumstances that would continue, but I knew I had enough ammunition to make it a worthy attack.
moves.14. Bf4: Not so bad. Bxf7+ coupled with Ng5 might have resulted in some interesting lines.
moves.14... Bg4 15. Re1 Bd6: Exchanging a weak piece for a stronger one.
moves.16. Bxd6 Qxd6 17. Nbd2 Rfe8 18. Qc2 Rac8: Now my focus switches from the kingside to the center, where the weak d3 pawn lies.
moves.22. Qd1 Ne5: Besides attacking the d-pawn, the knight can easily provide assistance for a kingside attack.
moves.23. Ndf3 Bg4 24. Qd2: A critical error that open up white's kingisde even further.
moves.24... Nxf3+ 25. Nxf3 Bxf3 26. gxf3 Nh5: Trying to produce strong threats with a knight on f4.
moves.27... Qg6+ 28. Kf1 Kf8: Even though black's queen is still on the board, it can't make any viable threats against my king.
moves.29. Qe4: Asking for an exchange to take out any sting in my attack.
moves.29... Qxe4: I have a pawn majority on the kingside, so why not exchange?
moves.30. fxe4 Nf4: An important move to keep white at my whim.
White should have kept its king nearer. Bb1 was better.
moves.38... h3 39. Kf1 h2:
The power of the knight truly shines now. White resigns. 

Lessons from the game;
1) Don't play the Hillbilly attack :)
2) Play h3 and a3 moves only if necessary. They are often misused.

gameName: H3 and A3 Allowed Black to Conquer
